metadata.title: CVE-2024-47690 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:f2fs: get rid of online repaire on corrupted directorysyzbot reports a f2fs bug as below:kernel BUG at fs/f2fs/inode.c:896!RIP: 0010:f2fs_evict_inode+0x1598/0x15c0 fs/f2fs/inode.c:896Call Trace: evict+0x532/0x950 fs/inode.c:704 dispose_list fs/inode.c:747 [inline] evict_inodes+0x5f9/0x690 fs/inode.c:797 generic_shutdown_super+0x9d/0x2d0 fs/super.c:627 kill_block_super+0x44/0x90 fs/super.c:1696 kill_f2fs_super+0x344/0x690 fs/f2fs/super.c:4898 deactivate_locked_super+0xc4/0x130 fs/super.c:473 cleanup_mnt+0x41f/0x4b0 fs/namespace.c:1373 task_work_run+0x24f/0x310 kernel/task_work.c:228 ptrace_notify+0x2d2/0x380 kernel/signal.c:2402 ptrace_report_syscall include/linux/ptrace.h:415 [inline] ptrace_report_syscall_exit include/linux/ptrace.h:477 [inline] syscall_exit_work+0xc6/0x190 kernel/entry/common.c:173 syscall_exit_to_user_mode_prepare kernel/entry/common.c:200 [inline] __syscall_exit_to_user_mode_work kernel/entry/common.c:205 [inline] syscall_exit_to_user_mode+0x279/0x370 kernel/entry/common.c:218 do_syscall_64+0x100/0x230 arch/x86/entry/common.c:89 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x77/0x7fRIP: 0010:f2fs_evict_inode+0x1598/0x15c0 fs/f2fs/inode.c:896Online repaire on corrupted directory in f2fs_lookup() can generatedirty data/meta while racing w/ readonly remount, it may leave dirtyinode after filesystem becomes readonly, however, checkpoint() willskips flushing dirty inode in a state of readonly mode, result inabove panic.Let's get rid of online repaire in f2fs_lookup(), and leave the workto fsck.f2fs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-47690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-127-generic - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-5.15.0-127-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-generic - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-generic-64k - 5.15.0-127.137
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1070-kvm - 5.15.0-1070.75
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1073-aws - 5.15.0-1073.79
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1078-azure - 5.15.0-1078.87
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1072-gcp - 5.15.0-1072.80
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1070-gke - 5.15.0-1070.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1056-gkeop - 5.15.0-1056.63
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1066-ibm - 5.15.0-1066.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1071-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1071.77
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-lowlatency - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-127.137
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1068-nvidia - 5.15.0-1068.69
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1068-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1068.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1071-oracle - 5.15.0-1071.77
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-127.137').
